intro: Hieracium peracuens, commonly known as the Peracuens hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are generally hairy and alternate, with a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
